intro: Valeriana tafiensis, commonly known as the Tafi valerian, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, strongly scented aroma. Valeriana tafiensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its calming effects.
